class.name: AuthoritativeLobbyClient
class.brief_description: Node for connecting to the Blazium Lobby service. Offers authoritative lobby making features.
class.description:
The [AuthoritativeLobbyClient] node provides an interface for connecting to the Blazium Authoritative service. There is a free instance hosted on the [url=https://blazium.app]blazium.app[/url] domain that is used by default. The normal flow is as follows: 1. Listen to all the signals you are interested in. 2. Connect to the server using [method connect_to_lobby] method. 3. Call any other methods to create, view or join lobbies, as well as add data to them. 4. Close the session using [method disconnect_from_lobby] method at the end of the game. [b]Note:[/b] Some methods are non blocking and can be awaited in order to get the result. There are also members on this class that are automatically updated as the lobby gets updated, such as: - [member peer]: The current peer. Reflects changes to the self peer. - [member peers]: The lobby peers. Reflects changes to all peers. - [member lobby]: The lobby. Reflects changes to the lobby. - [member peer_data]: The current peer private data.
[b]Note:[/b] The main difference between this service and the non authoritative [LobbyClient] are: - The host cannot set any data or notify peer_disconnected. - The [signal received_lobby_data] signal doesn't have the [code]is_private[/code] parameter.

method.name: add_lobby_tags
method.description: Add tags to the lobby. Only works if you are host. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_tagged].

method.name: add_peer_user_data
method.description: Add user data to your own peer. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal received_peer_user_data].

method.name: connect_to_lobby
method.description: Connect to a Blazium Lobby Server using the [member game_id] and [member server_url]. Generates [signal connected_to_lobby] signal if successful.

method.name: create_lobby
method.description: Create a lobby and become host. If you are already in a lobby, you cannot create one. You need to leave first. The new lobby can have a title, tags, max players and password. 0 max players means unlimited. Returns a [ViewLobbyResponse] object that has a [signal ViewLobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_created] signal.

method.name: del_lobby_tags
method.description: Delete one or more keys from the lobby tags. Only works if you are host. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_tagged].

method.name: del_peer_user_data
method.description: Delete one or more keys from the peers user data. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal received_peer_user_data].

method.name: disconnect_from_lobby
method.description: Disconnect from the lobby server. Generates [signal disconnected_from_lobby] signal.

method.name: is_host
method.description: Returns true if you are the host of the current lobby.

method.name: join_lobby
method.description: Join a lobby. If you are already in a lobby, you cannot join another one. You need to leave first. If the lobby you want to join is password protected, you need to provide the password. Returns a [ViewLobbyResponse] object that has a [signal ViewLobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_joined].

method.name: kick_peer
method.description: Kick a peer. You need to be host to do so. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal peer_left] signal with kicked set to true.

method.name: leave_lobby
method.description: Leave a lobby. You need to be in a lobby to leave one. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_left].

method.name: list_lobbies
method.description: Lists all lobbies. Lobbies that are sealed won't show in the list, except if you disconnected and trying to reconnect to a lobby.

method.name: lobby_call
method.description: Call a method on the server.

method.name: send_chat_message
method.description: Send a chat message. Only works if you are in a lobby. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal peer_messaged].

method.name: set_lobby_ready
method.description: Ready up in the lobby. You need to be in a lobby and unready to run this. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal peer_ready].

method.name: set_lobby_sealed
method.description: Seals the lobby. You need to be the host to do this and the lobby needs to be unsealed. Returns a [LobbyResponse] object that has a [signal LobbyResponse.finished] signal that is emitted when finished. Generates [signal lobby_sealed].

signal.name: connected_to_lobby
signal.description: Signal generated after you connect to the lobby.

signal.name: disconnected_from_lobby
signal.description: Signal generated after you disconnect from the lobby.

signal.name: lobby_created
signal.description: Signal generated after a lobby is created.

signal.name: lobby_joined
signal.description: Signal generated after you joint a lobby.

signal.name: lobby_left
signal.description: Signal generated after you leave a lobby.

signal.name: lobby_notified
signal.description: Signal generated after a notification is received.

signal.name: lobby_sealed
signal.description: Signal generated after the host seals the lobby.

signal.name: lobby_tagged
signal.description: Signal generated after the host updated the tags of the lobby

signal.name: log_updated
signal.description: Signals a log from a command.

signal.name: peer_disconnected
signal.description: Signal generated after a peer disconnects. If they don't reconnect they will be removed.

signal.name: peer_joined
signal.description: Signal generated after a peer joins the lobby.

signal.name: peer_left
signal.description: Signal generated after a peer leaves the lobby.

signal.name: peer_messaged
signal.description: Signal generated after a peer sends a chat message.

signal.name: peer_ready
signal.description: Signal generated after a peer is ready.

signal.name: peer_reconnected
signal.description: Signal generated after a peer reconnects.

signal.name: received_lobby_data
signal.description: Signal generated after data is sent to the lobby.

signal.name: received_peer_data
signal.description: Signal generated after data is sent to peer.

signal.name: received_peer_user_data
signal.description: Signal generated after user data is sent to peer.
